Say we have an image named `image.png` located next to our `.tex` file, we can import it with `\includegraphics` and add alt text:

<CodeSnippet
  latex={String.raw`

\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{graphicx}
\begin{document}

\includegraphics[alt={My alt text}]{image.png}

\end{document}

`}
withImages={{
    '/image.png': "data:image/png;base64,"
  }}
/>

Images may have the extensions `.jpg`, `.png` or `.svg`, however I've noticed `\includegraphics` will not accept `.svg` images when compiled with `pdflatex`. I do currently attempt to convert `.pdf` images to `.svg` with mixed success.

To add a caption, and/or reference an image, wrap the `includegraphics` macro with a `\figure` environment:

<CodeSnippet
  latex={String.raw`

\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{graphicx}
\usepackage[noabbrev, capitalise, nameinlink]{cleveref}
\begin{document}

\begin{figure}
\centering
\label{fig:logo}
\includegraphics[alt={My alt text}]{image.png}
\caption{My \textbf{caption} text}
\end{figure}

Refer to \cref{fig:logo}.

\end{document}

`}
withImages={{
    '/image.png': "data:image/png;base64,"
  }}
/>
